column3: NACK, this implies that the caller calls `Shutdown()` if return is false.\n
The destructor will call it, which will be invoked automatically whether Initialize returns false or not.\n
@laanwj assuming you delete the object.. nevertheless `Initialize()` should be all or nothing. Removing the call to `Shutdown()` leaves the notification interface partially initialised.\n
@promag CreateWithArguments deletes the object if initialization fails \n
@mrbandrews @laanwj right, forgot `Initialize()` is protected. I take it back.\n

> assuming you delete the object

Sure. But well if not that's a memory leak, and thus a bug in self.
